page.title: 17LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: Northop is a small village situated off the A55(T) about 3 miles from the county town of Mold. The village is centred around St.Peter's Church.Also in the village is a modern estate sharing the same name. This consists of detached,semi-detached houses and bungalows. It has a county primary school called Ysgol Owen Jones, a playgroup and library that is open on Tuesdays and Fridays.The local bus service connects the village with Flint and Chester. Despite its size, the village is not very well serviced with shopping facilities.It includes a post office,fish and chip shop, butchers, grocers and garage. As well as the church there is a congregational chapel.Socially,it is well off with a workingmen's club,an institute, a large and succesful cricket club and band.
